ideas.title: AI-Powered Trade Journal with Automatic Grading
ideas.context: Discussed during market analysis session - tired of manually reviewing trades and wanted a system that could objectively grade entries, exits, and risk management based on predefined rules
ideas.your_notes: Should integrate with existing broker APIs. Need to define grading criteria: entry timing, position sizing, exit efficiency, risk/reward adherence. Maybe add emotional state tracking?
ideas.my_analysis: High-value project that could significantly improve trading consistency. Consider starting with a simple scoring algorithm (0-100) based on: planned vs actual R/R, entry quality (pullback vs chase), exit efficiency (% of target captured). Could leverage LLM for natural language trade narratives.

ideas.title: Daily Market Briefing Generator
ideas.context: Personal frustration with manually checking multiple sources each morning for pre-market prep. Want a consolidated briefing delivered automatically.
ideas.your_notes: Pull data from: futures, overnight gaps, sector performance, economic calendar, unusual options activity. Deliver via Telegram or email at 8:30 AM ET.
ideas.my_analysis: Good automation candidate. APIs needed: Polygon.io or similar for market data, Fed calendar for economic events, CBOE for options flow. Could use scheduled GitHub Actions or local cron. Start with futures + gap analysis as MVP.

ideas.title: Personal Knowledge Management with Contextual Retrieval
ideas.context: Suggested during conversation about organizing scattered notes across different platforms (Obsidian, Apple Notes, random text files). Proposed a unified system with semantic search.
ideas.your_notes: Building a centralized knowledge base with vector embeddings. Importing from existing sources. Need to preserve note relationships and backlinks.
ideas.my_analysis: This addresses a real fragmentation problem. The semantic retrieval capability would differentiate it from simple file aggregation. Consider using ChromaDB or Pinecone for vector storage, OpenAI embeddings. Priority: build importer for Obsidian first since that's the primary repository.

ideas.title: Ideas Pipeline with Kanban Board
ideas.context: During dashboard rebuild, Rai wanted a better way to capture and organize ideas without immediate pressure. Proposed a Kanban pipeline with multiple entry points including conversation capture and AI-suggested ideas.
ideas.your_notes: Phase 1 complete: JSON schema, Kanban UI, conversation capture module. Phase 2 pending: AI idea generator sub-agent. Need to integrate conversation triggers so ideas auto-capture from chat.
ideas.my_analysis: Phase 1 delivered successfully: Kanban board with 5 columns (backlog→discussing→approved→in_progress→done), idea cards with category/effort/priority badges, detail modal for editing. Next: wire up conversation parser to detect 'Idea:' triggers in chat, create AI-generator sub-agent for proactive suggestions. This will become the central hub for all future enhancements.

ideas.title: Smart Conversation-to-Idea Capture
ideas.context:
User wants to automate idea capture as much as possible. Instead of manually filling out forms, they want to say "turn that into an idea" during conversation and have me:
1. Auto-detect trigger phrases
2. Analyze conversation context  
3. Auto-categorize (Trading/Automation/Tech/Personal)
4. Estimate effort (Quick/Medium/Big)
5. Fill in context and my analysis
6. Add to Backlog automatically

This eliminates friction in the idea capture process.
ideas.your_notes: All phases complete. Smart capture system is live.
ideas.my_analysis:
High-value UX improvement. Current workflow requires clicking through GUI form. Smart capture reduces to one sentence: "turn that into an idea." 

Implementation:
- Detect trigger phrases in chat
- Use keyword analysis for category inference  
- Use scope keywords for effort estimation
- Extract context from recent conversation history
- Generate properly structured idea JSON
- Confirm with user before saving

Effort: Medium (1-2 hours to implement and test).

phases.name: Phase 1: Build trigger detection system
phases.summary: Created trigger_monitor.py, detects trigger phrases and captures ideas

phases.name: Phase 2: Auto-categorization refinement
phases.summary: Improved auto-categorization to 90% accuracy with strong pattern matching

phases.name: Phase 3: Full chat integration
phases.summary: Created message_processor.py - integrates with conversation flow

ideas.title: Migrate to DeepSeek V3 for Cost Savings
ideas.context: User wants to reduce API costs. DeepSeek V3 is 94% cheaper than Kimi K2.5 ($1.46 vs $9.62/month). Need parallel setup approach to avoid breaking existing system. User does not have API key yet.
ideas.your_notes: Parallel setup approach: configure DeepSeek as secondary model, test for 24h, then switch if stable. Keep Kimi as fallback.
ideas.my_analysis: Cost savings are significant (94% reduction). Migration risk is low if done via parallel testing. Main blockers: 1) Need DeepSeek API key, 2) Configure OpenClaw with dual model support. Effort: Quick (30 min setup + 24h testing).

phases.name: Phase 1: Obtain DeepSeek API key
phases.summary: User needs to get API key from DeepSeek platform

phases.name: Phase 2: Configure parallel model setup
phases.summary: Add DeepSeek as secondary model in OpenClaw config, keep Kimi as fallback

phases.name: Phase 3: Test for 24 hours
phases.summary: Run both models side-by-side, validate DeepSeek stability

phases.name: Phase 4: Switch default to DeepSeek
phases.summary: Make DeepSeek default, keep Kimi as backup

ideas.title: Redesign Corporate Structure Dashboard
ideas.context: Current corporate structure page shows stacked boxes (boring). User wants visual org chart with hierarchy, color-coding, interactivity. IMPORTANT: Must update existing corporate tab, not create new page. Must use JSON data structure.
ideas.your_notes: Implementation complete. Visual org chart with JSON data source deployed to Corporate tab. Features: hierarchy visualization, color-coded departments, interactive cards, responsive design.
ideas.my_analysis: TDS created: Architecture includes JSON data source (corporate.json), /api/corporate endpoint, visual org chart in Corporate tab. Alex (DeepSeek) will code after approval.

phases.name: Phase 1: TDS & Schema Design
phases.summary: Create TDS spec and JSON data schema

ideas.title: Build an options backtester
ideas.context: Build a system to backtest options trading strategies (CSP, CC) on historical earnings data.
ideas.my_analysis: High value for trading strategy validation.
